title: 112_hr4234
content: The "Grazing Improvement Act of 2012" amends the terms of grazing permits and leases to extend the duration to 20 years from the previous 10 years. It also includes provisions for the renewal, transfer, and reissuance of grazing permits and leases. The "Grazing Improvement Act of 2012" extends the duration of grazing permits and leases to 20 years from 10 years and includes provisions for their renewal, transfer, and reissuance. Additionally, Title IV of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 is amended to address these changes. The "Grazing Improvement Act of 2012" defines current grazing management and the Secretary concerned. It also addresses the renewal, transfer, reissuance, and pending processing of grazing permits or leases issued by the Secretary of the Interior. The Grazing Improvement Act of 2012 outlines the renewal process for grazing permits or leases issued by the Secretary of the Interior or Agriculture, specifying the applicable sections for renewal. The terms and conditions of expired permits continue until the renewal process is completed by the Secretary concerned. The Grazing Improvement Act of 2012 specifies the process for renewing grazing permits or leases, allowing for cancellation, suspension, or modification as per applicable law. The Secretary may renew or reissue permits for 20 years after processing, with discretion to comply with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969. The Secretary may be exempt from preparing an environmental assessment or impact statement if renewing grazing management, meeting objectives, or following department policies. Priority and timing for environmental analyses are at the discretion of the Secretary. The Secretary has the discretion to determine the priority and timing for completing environmental analysis for grazing allotments, permits, or leases based on environmental significance and available funding. NEPA exemptions include crossing and trailing authorizations of livestock and transfer of grazing preference. Amendments to the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 are made to include these exemptions in the table of contents. "Sec. 405. Renewal, transfer, and reissuance of grazing permits and leases."
